posts.name: ericjanofski
posts.cooked:
We are having a red alliance issue with our YAGSL implementation.

We aren’t using Streamed Driver Input that is in the example but a custom TeleopDriveCommand.

We are using the “always blue” coordinate system to help with Pathplanner.

In our TeleopDriveCommand we’ve inverted our controls for red… works great.

Our rotation of the bot was backwards, so we added zeroGyroWithAlliance() to the swerve drive constructor and that seems to be working well as well.

The problem is when we localize our robot off of the April Tags. Since we’ve flipped the bot 180 we get strange issues when localizing off the april tags.

I’m thinking we should get the bot pose from the april tag as blue, but get the rotation of the april tags as red?

Has anyone worked with this issue?

Here’s our code, thank you: FRC2025/src/main/java/frc/robot at main · team6637/FRC2025 · GitHub

posts.name: Maia
posts.cooked: At least for our team, we don’t update our robot’s rotational heading off April Tag readings since IMU’s generally have low enough drift that it creates more noise to update it. To do this, we just set an insanely high standard deviation for updating rotations (99999999 or something like that) so the measurements are effectively never used.

posts.name: Owen Busler
posts.cooked:
HarbringerOfAuroras:

99999999

Do you know what the " default " standard deviations are? we want to implement this (ignore the rotation component of the April tag pose) but dont know what to set the x and y to.  What even is the range of the std?

posts.name: Maia
posts.cooked: Here is the WPILib page on the subject. Since this gives no numbers, our code has .7 for the x and y standard deviations and the aforementioned 9999999 for rotation.

declaration: package: edu.wpi.first.math.estimator, class: SwerveDrivePoseEstimator

posts.name: Jason Johnson
posts.cooked:
ericjanofski:

Our rotation of the bot was backwards

We had the same issue.  On YAGSL positive input values correspond to CCW rotation and negative input corresponds with CW rotation.  We are inverted the XBOX right stick and that fixed the rotation issue.

posts.name: ericjanofski
posts.cooked:
In the end we were overcomplicating things. I had a misunderstanding of how Pathplanner was flipping for red. The solution was to make sure our pose was set correctly when practicing teleop as red (setting pose to 180 at start). Then we negated our stick controls and all was well.

Pathplanner not only mirrors, but flips making it super easy this year to go from Blue to Red. What I had to do to understand this was make a TestAuto that just went forward and to the side a bit, then I ran it as Blue and Red and watched the robot on the Shuffleboard Field visualizer. This showed exactly how our pose was modified by pathplanner.

After learning all this we didn’t have to do anything to our apriltag pose drive function. We just had to have the better understanding of our inial pose as we started the match.
